sentences.english: You picture the family by the fire, the student lighting and relighting his pipe.
sentences.chinese: 想到圍坐在爐火旁的一家人，一個不斷點菸斗的學者。

sentences.english: You've got big hair and a comely doo.
sentences.chinese: 你有一個漂亮的頭髮，大斗。

sentences.english: This coal is enough to fill ten coal cars.
N You used to smoke a pipe , didn't you?
sentences.chinese: 你過去一向是抽菸斗的，對不對？

sentences.english: Incaution in making friend is the main cause to make many people confront trouble.
sentences.chinese: 交友不慎是很多人栽觔斗的主要原因。

sentences.english: You used to smoke a pipe , didn't you?
sentences.chinese: 你以前一向是抽菸斗的，對不對？

sentences.english: Windcatchers are sometimes used in conjunction with underground water canals to cool buildings.
sentences.chinese: 招風斗有時和地下水管道聯合起來使用以冷卻建築物。

sentences.english: Can complete work with food lifting elevator, cup metering device, output conveyor, etc.
sentences.chinese: 可配置量杯計量裝置，大斗物料提升機，成品輸送機。

definition: to strive for/to vie for/to argue or debate/deficient or lacking (dialect)/how or what (literary)
to vie against one another/to fight each other/mutual aggression
to match one's strength with/to compete/more competitive/to set oneself against sb/disobliging/to make a special effort
lit. you die, I live (idiom); irreconcilable adversaries/two parties cannot coexist
to have a competition/to measure with one's hand or arm/to make a gesture of measuring
to fight openly and maneuver covertly (idiom)
unable to determine victory or defeat (idiom); evenly matched/to come out even/to tie/to draw
